author: Staff Reporter
text:
The State government on Monday informed the Madras High Court that the temporary conditional recognition granted to over 746 unrecognised schools in the State will not be extended beyond May 31.

The authorities made the submission before the First Bench headed by Chief Justice S.K. Kaul on a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) petition moved by Change India organisation seeking to quash a Government Order (GO) dated August 18, 2015 issued by the School Education Secretary and consequently to forbear Chief Secretary, Directorate of Matriculation Schools, School Education and Elementary Education from granting recognition to unrecognised schools which have not fulfilled the mandatory norms.

The petitioner also wanted the court to ensure that all the unrecognised schools are closed by the end of the academic year 2015-16 and to ensure that the students of such schools are placed in other neighbourhood government/ aided/ unaided schools.
title: Temporary recognition for schools won't be extended: govt.
